actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1262.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure failed of passage in House under suspension of rules, roll call #422 (269-138).

official_title: A bill to amend section 5701 (a) (2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 so as to change the bracket tax on cigars to an ad valorem tax.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1262) Revises the Internal Revenue Code in order to change the bracket tax on cigars to an ad valorem tax. States that the tax on cigars weighing more than three pounds per thousand shall be eight and one-half percent of the wholesale price but not more than $20 per thousand. Defines wholesale price as manufacturer's suggested delivered price, at which the cigars are to be sold to retailers, inclusive of the tax imposed by this Act, but exclusive of any State or local taxes imposed on cigars as a commodity. Provides that records of manufacturers shall be available for inspection by any internal revenue officer during business hours.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 5701 (a) (2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 so as to change the bracket tax on cigars to an ad valorem tax.
